examples: a marginal improvement in weather conditions
The story will only be of marginal interest to our readers.
The difference between the two estimates is marginal.

meanings.def: relating to or resulting from small changes
examples: All three companies reported marginal revenue growth.

meanings.def: not part of a main or important group or situation
examples: Welsh was considered a marginal language.

meanings.def: won or lost by a very small number of votes and therefore very important or interesting as evidence of public opinion
examples: They risk losing key marginal seats at the next election.

meanings.def: written in the margin of a page
that cannot produce enough good crops to make a profit
a seat in a parliament, on a local council, etc. that was won by a very small number of votes
